# Anaconda Installation Guide for Windows

## Introduction

This guide will walk you through the process of installing Anaconda, a popular Python distribution, on your Windows computer. Anaconda provides a convenient way to manage Python packages and environments for data science and scientific computing.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

1. A Windows computer.
2. An internet connection.
3. Sufficient disk space for the installation.

## Installation Steps

### 1. Download Anaconda

Visit the Anaconda download page at [https://www.anaconda.com/download](https://www.anaconda.com/download).

### 2. Choose the Windows Installer

Click on the "Download" button under the Windows section to download the Anaconda installer for Windows.

![Download Anaconda](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-1.png)

### 3. Run the Installer

- Locate the downloaded file (usually in your "Downloads" folder).
- Double-click the installer executable (`.exe`) file to run it.

![Run Installer](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-2.png)

### 4. Follow the Installer Wizard

- Follow the on-screen instructions to begin the installation.
- Read and accept the license agreement when prompted.

![Read Me](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-3.png)

![License Agreement](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-4.png)

- Choose the installation type. It's recommended to select "Just me" unless you have specific reasons for a different choice.

![Installation Type](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-5.png)

- Select the installation location (the default is usually fine).

![Installation Location](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-6.png)

### 5. Install Anaconda

Click the "Install" button to begin the installation process. This may take a few minutes.

![Install](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-7.png)

### 6. Complete the Installation

Once the installation is complete, you will see a confirmation message. Click the "Next" button and proceed to finish.

![Installation Complete](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-8.png)

![Close Installation Wizard](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-10.png)

### 7. If prompted to update the navigator, select "No, don't show again"

![Don't Update](images/screenshots/anaconda-mac/screenshot-10.png)

### 8. You're <u>NOT REQUIRED</u> to Log in/Sign up for Anaconda Cloud, close the prompt by clicking the "x" button

![Don't Log in/Sign up](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-11.png)

### 10. Verify the Installation

<!-- Open the "Terminal" application on your macOS computer and type the following command to verify that Anaconda and Jupyter were installed successfully:

```bash
jupyter --version
```

![Open Terminal](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-12.png)

![Verify Jupyter Installation](images/screenshots/anaconda-mac/screenshot-12.png) -->

To verify the installation launch a local Jupyter Server by clicking on the "launch" button for Jupyter Notebook.

![Launch Jupyter Server](images/screenshots/anaconda-mac/screenshot-14.png)

You should see a Jupyter Notebbok server launched in a browser window.

![Jupyter Server Launched](images/screenshots/anaconda-windows/screenshot-13.png)

## Conclusion

Congratulations! You've successfully installed Anaconda on your Windows computer. You can now use Anaconda to create Python environments, manage packages, and work on data science projects.

For more information on using Anaconda, refer to the official documentation at [https://docs.anaconda.com/](https://docs.anaconda.com/).

If you encounter any issues or have questions, don't hesitate to seek help from the Anaconda community or consult the documentation for troubleshooting tips.
